methodologyPopup.title: Methodology
methodologyPopup.description: To outline the overview of Human Rights Education (HRE) in Brazil, we gathered information from the federal ministries responsible for HRE and analyzed each of the states and the Federal District to understand the extent to which HRE has been institutionalized across the country. The information on the degrees of institutionalization shown in the interactive map—such as the existence of guiding documents, collegiate bodies, and government agencies dedicated to HRE—was collected biennially (in 2019–2020, 2021–2022, 2023–2024, and so on). The detailed data available when clicking on each state—such as budget, definitions, thematic focuses, etc.—was collected every four years, at the end of each government’s term (in 2022, 2024, and so on). The research was conducted through interviews and information made available on official websites, via email, by phone, and through freedom of information requests, in accordance with Law No. 12.527/11. It is important to note that the research methodology has been improved with each edition. Therefore, variations in the degree of institutionalization over the biennia do not necessarily reflect the advancement of HRE public policy, but rather improvements in the data collection tools used by Aurora Institute.
